resources.string: Thank you for choosing \nto grow, with Harho!
To get started, please enter the e-mail addressed used when purchasing your box and the unique reference number on your e-mail receipt.
Ahead of us placing your seeds, ensure the propagator is facing towards you as per the above image. The propagator number is located under each base
I Accept all Terms & Condition and\n Privacy Polices
Please return to the app to get started\n once you have received your box
which date are you installing your product for the first time?
You can expect a response \nwithin 48 hours
Please e-mail INFO@HARHO.CO.UK \nwith your unique reference number stating which item you are missing\n
The soil is now ready \nto use.
Your now ready to plant your seeds\u000D\n
As you start mixing, make sure to reach the soil at the bottom of the bag. This ensures a consistent mixture
you will need this space to cover your soon to\n be placed seeds with your spare soil
Break up soil and stir into water to create a light, open mixture.
Make sure to only fill each propagator up to the\n line indicated below
Peel the sticker and unwrap the bag. Add 1.5L of (lukewarm) water

Seed depth is crucial to ensuring healthy
 growth, different produce requires different 
depths - Too shallow and it may not grow 
strong enough, too deep and it might not break 
through
Take propagator 1 - Number is located \n underneath the propagator
As per image above, place seeds on the top of \nthe soil, in the formation shown - Place seeds at \n least 0.5cm away from the sides
Using your seed planter, push the newly placed \nseeds into the soil - The images below show \nhow far to push the Seed Planter into the soil
Your installation is now \ncomplete, welcome to\n My Harho

In the day - Generally, the temperature within 
your home will be sufficient to keep your 
produce growing without your propagator lids 
on, we recommend keeping them off and 
only using within winter months when your heating 
on

At night - Best practice is to keep your lids on,
 generally it is cooler during this time. Not 
essential however growing conditions could be 
improved by doing this
The section on the left shows soil which has \nbeen left unwatered for too long - if parts of\nyour soil starts to turn to this colour, water immediately

Take a small pinch of soil (In a space where you 
have not planted) if the soil crumbles out of 
your fingers, it requires watering. If it sticks, your 
soil does not require watering
Try to avoid spraying the leaves of the plant,
this will cause produce to wilt and could impact \ngrowth

Your produce will naturally grow towards the 
sunlight, once a week ensure you turn your 
propagator to keep your produce growing 
straight and healthy

Basil is an annual herb that typically needs 
to be replanted each year, although some 
varieties can be overwintered indoors or in
 mild climates.
